isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER, GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 9800 - CLUSTER PROGRAMMING

svcproc.title: CLUSTER PROGRAMMING

note.para: Any changes in vehicle components such as tire size, axle ratio, etc. requires the engine ECM to be reprogrammed and not the speedometer/tachometer microprocessor. Refer to engine manufacturer's service manual for information on reprogramming.

svcproc.para: The International 9800 series vehicles are only offered with electronically controlled engines. Therefore, the speedometer/tachometer module should be programmed to read information from the data link. The cluster may be programmed by using an Electronic Service Tool (EST), such as the EZ-Tech™ with the Instrument Cluster Software, connected to the data link. The cluster DIP switches should all be set to 0. Refer to the appropriate Electronic Service Tool manual for instructions.

If a loss of programming is suspected, and a service tool is not available, the DIP switches may be set to "1" for use with an electronic engine. The odometer switch (Number ten (10) on right bank) should be set to "0" for miles or "1" for kilometers.

caution.para: Moving any of the dip switches from the 0 position disables the speedometer/tachometer programming. If a DIP switch is moved, inaccurate vehicle operation data will be displayed on the speedometer, tachometer, and odometer. (Moving the switches back to the 0 position will re-enable the speedometer/tachometer programming.)
